        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> runTaskInParallel(InternalEquinoxTask<?> task)
        Runs given task in parallel execution mode.
        Parameters:
        task - Task to be executed in parallel mode.
        Returns:

      • runTaskSequentially

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> runTaskSequentially(InternalEquinoxTask<?> task)
        Runs given task sequentially.
        Parameters:
        task - Task to be executed.
        Returns:

      • runTasksSequentially

        public void runTasksSequentially(InternalEquinoxTask<?>... tasks)
        Runs given tasks in sequential mode. Tasks are executed in the given order.
        Parameters:
        tasks - Tasks to be executed in sequential mode.

      • runTaskSilently

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> runTaskSilently(InternalEquinoxTask<?> task,
                                                      boolean isSequential)
        Runs given task silently (i.e. no task submission notification will be shown). This method is useful to execute tasks directly from within other tasks (i.e. not from FX application thread).
        Parameters:
        task - Task to be executed.
        isSequential - True if task should be executed within the sequential task queue.
        Returns:
        Returns a Future representing that task. The Future's get method will return null upon successful completion.

      • taskStateChanged

        public void taskStateChanged(InternalEquinoxTask<?> task,
                             javafx.concurrent.Worker.State state)
        Called from task panel when ever a task's state has changed.
        Parameters:
        task - Task whose state has changed.
        state - New task state.

        public void showModal()
